featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I think that this university if AMAZING! I am so glad I committed to such a wonderful college with great diversity, student life, and academics. The professors here really care about your college experience, and the counselors are extremely open to helping you out when you are struggling with your classes/major/whatever it may be.  If there was something that I could recommend that we add to our campus it would be to maybe remodel the interior of the Knight library, because it's definitely starting to fall apart. All of the carpets and chairs are getting really old and grungy, and I think that having a prettier interior would attract many more students to study in the library!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I've attended the University of South Dakota for 2 years now and I absolutely love it here. USD professors and advisors genuinely want students to do well and will go above and beyond to support you in doing so. Very understanding, professors engage students and are always available to help. I can't recall ever having a bad or even lacklustre professor, all of them (even SI instructors, TAs, and grad school professors) have been incredible. Highly recommend!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I love the classes for my major offered by the University. They are engaging with great professors that are approachable outside of lecture. The professors for the music classes are especially great and have made it easy to stay in music even as a non-music major. Getting between classes can be a little difficult as a biology music student but the campus is bike-able which helps a lot! There are so many clubs on campus it is hard to limit yourself to just a handful. I am active in two clubs but also get updates and information for another two clubs. There is lots of outdoor space for enjoying nice weather, which helps for getting out of studying slumps.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I love Boulder! Anyone and everyone is welcomed to be themselves regardless of their affiliations! The school does a fantastic job of making students proud of their school with the beautiful campus and enthusiastic culture. You find that CU alumns are all around the country, eager to return your "Go Buffs!" with one of their own. Your college experience is what you make of it. You are free to either party all the time, work-hard, or find a healthy medium. Boulder students know how to get involved in the outdoors so it is not difficult to find someone to bike with, hike with, or relax on lawns in the sunshine with. CU looks massive on paper, but it immediately felt like a second home.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love being a student here at Westminster! I am a music major and have been able to get involved with the amazing voice program here. The music professors are absolutely amazing and I have learned so much already! The thing I love is that everything is so personal. Class sizes are small so the professor really care about each and every individual student. I feel very important here. I also love the vibe and campus life that is here. I'm a commuter student, so I do not live on campus, but I still have felt very included because of the student body. Every here is so inclusive and kind and makes me feel like I am in a very safe and loving environment. College was a really scary thing for me when I was in high school, but once I started to get involved here at Westminster, I've discovered that it's not scary at all! It's so amazing and I cannot wait to see what is yet to come.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: DePaul University is academically stimulating, socially enriching, and caters to support individuals of any background. The academics are enlightening and incorporates a healthy balance of neurological stimulation without being too challenging. Diversity is present, however, can be improved (as anywhere else). The Athletic facilities are impressive! The Professors are individually unique and most often offer guidance, whether academically or on a more personal level. DePaul offers a wide range of student related resources and services that can benefit one's overall experience. DePaul is a platform, what you do with it is up to you!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: The campus of the University is beautifully crafted and redesigned.  The blueprints were staged by former Engineering Alumni.  This significant mark on the campus is a great accomplishment and success story in its own for new students to be captivated by.  The school tours are lead by selected honors students of the university who also mentor, guide, and inspire new students.     The university has the highest number of students enrolled ever this year.  The campus is centrally located to multiple apartment buildings and restaurants.  The campus holds multiple job fairs, opportunity fairs, career progression panels, and other such organizations are well known to the community.  The welcoming to freshmen, involvement, and connection building is very prominent, including sororities and fraternities, but also with sports, ROTC programs, and other events.  Tutoring is included with tuition!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: This school provides me with countless opportunities to get involved with clubs that I'm interested in. There is something for everyone!  I joined the student television network here my freshman year and learned to edit news videos and interview students and faculty. They encourage students to be their best by aligning their values with being "first" since Delaware is the first state.  There are various courses to cater to each student's needs and majors. We also have fun classes to take the pressure off our hard classes! They have a great plan to grow the diversity in our school and keep us safe as we are running across campus. They encourage unity while allowing you to be yourself.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: I have loved my time at Pacific University. I was able to succeed in academics and athletics. I have been very busy, but the professors are amazing in the way they work with their students and get to know them. If I could change anything it would be school spirit. We need more students participating in events! Other than that I love it and would highly recommend.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: BW is great! As a mid-year transfer student I was really nervous having to start everything over again. I went from a huge state school to a very small school. The faculty & staff are very kind. My professors know me by name and want what's best for me, in & outside of the classroom. From understanding the course work to finding an internship or getting involved on campus, they truly make an effort to make sure that we are taking advantage of all the opportunities that are provided here at Baldwin Wallace University.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: From day one, as a transfer student Stockton won me over with its incredibly genuine, warm, caring staff. On orientation day the staff made me feel so welcome, everyone was so friendly, and not because they had to be, it was truly genuine! The actual DEAN of my department spent over an hour with me helping to map out my first semester by going over different course selections available for me, helping to make sure I didn't waste time or money picking classes that would not benefit my intended major. The academics are challenging and many employers see Stockton University as a highly credited institution to graduate from. I highly recommend any student looking for a college where they will easily fit in and belong. There are so many activities to keep busy and because Stockton is situated in the heart of South Jersey, its relatively close to anything you could need. Between Atlantic City, Philadelphia and New York City there are endless possibilities for fun weekends away!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body:
I can reflect upon the exciting memories formed by the lovely university known as the University at Buffalo. Cheering on the UB Bulls by joining a fanbase, dining in at one of the eat-ins on campus, attending a gathering to prepare for whatever event was to take place, engaging in photography with UB's aesthetic atmosphere, staying fit in UB's well-kept Alumni Arena, and more. In addition to memories, the staff had a profound impact on me and how I carry myself to this day. Whether it be an intro class or a more fine-tuned 400-level class, each professor that has given a lecture to me has granted me the opportunity of hearing new insight and viewing the world in a fresh perspective. 

I resided in Ellicott Complex, which served as shelter for my first-year experience. The cleanliness and proximity to class/dining is unparalleled. My brother, another UB student, resided in Goodyear and has the same opinion as I for Ellicott. To new UB students I say you will not regret it!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Amazing university. All the staffs energy is used to help students excel and succeed. There are many different orangizations that can aid students in their academic course work. The variety of clubs and diversity of the university allows students to feel included and involved. There is a wide spectrum of majors and minors. Everything from gender studies to Chinese culture! The university of Houston has many amenities that may benefit residential and commuting students such as a recreational center, three different food courts, an eight floor library, and three tutoring centers! My experience here has been nothing but the best!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I am a freshman at Howard University. I love it so much. It has already taught me so much not only in the classroom, but outside of the classroom as well.I love the surrounding DC environment because it offers diversity and fun. I love my on campus dorm and it is close to my classes. Howard University is a place you come to grow and gain knowledge on who you are and find who you want to be. I would recommend this school to everyone and anyone if I could! It is like a big family. The networking oppurtunities are endless. I love the culture because it is very rich and diverse. I am always meeting new people from so many places around the world. I have had good experiences thus far with all of my professors. I can tell they really want me to succeed and be the best that I can. Often, my parents ask me if I made the right decision. I am absolutely sure that I did and I could not be happier to have chosen to attend Howard University.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I absolutely love my university! It is a wonderful place to obtain a higher education, meet new people, and make connections that will last forever. I am most excited about finishing my bachelors, starting research in my area of study, and finding the perfect mentor. The university is always being renovated and they are bringing in local restaurants, which have some of the best food on campus! The campus is a great place to spend your whole day, whether it is spent studying, in class, or meeting with friends and professors. The campus is quite large, so it does take some time to walk from the parking areas to your classes, but there are shuttle buses available!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: I loved Temple University! Temple is a top academic institution, has over 140+ majors to choose from, is in the center of Philadelphia, with many alumni continuing to work in Philadelphia. Temple has a great support system, with students and teachers always willing to help. Did I mention the food options at Temple are great! There's food trucks lined up at every street! Temple University is the place to be. It is an investment you will not regret. It is an investment you will definitely reap the benefits from.  It is an honor to be "Temple Made."

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: California State University, Long Beach is a very diverse university with much to offer for example there are many majors offered, clubs, sports, internship opportunities and a variety of options to further your education. CSULB has many advisors on campus ready to assist you on any questions or concerns you may have, they're available and easy to contact. Due to the large amount of classes they offer, it makes it easier to schedule your classes accordingly to your personal life. Professors encourage and emphasize office hours all throughout the semester so every student could strive in class. There's not a thing I would change about my school!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I have thoroughly enjoyed my time at Utah State University. The professors are very engaging and willing to help their students. Furthermore, USU’s campus and the city of Logan are both amazing. I am very grateful for the opportunity I have had to go to school here. My only complaint is this: the counseling office at the business school is deplorable. The counselors are unworkable, slow, and useless. Nevertheless, the school and education itself are very good. In addition, I have enjoyed the student body at USU. They are humble, hardworking, and fun. Overall, I give Utah State University a four-star rating. They provide a great education for a reasonable price. Keep up the good work USU!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love being a part of a women centered college! Simmons is a wonderful place for people who want small classes with lots of participation. The service learning projects give you the chance to do things in the Boston community that can be applied to future jobs and give you wonderful experiences. It is a small school so that limits some of what is available but the Colleges of the Fenway partnership of the colleges in the area gives students plenty of classes and activities to do right around the corner. You also can not beat the location, right in the heart of Fenway you have a wonderful area surrounding the school. As well as the T to get you any where else you might want to go.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: The University of Arizona is an amazing opportunity that a lot of people can overlook. This institution has world-class professors and equipment in fields such as engineering, astrology, optics, and more. The strong athletic programs at the U fo A also bolster the school spirit and makes it easy to get fired up at sporting events with your schoolmate. As a student, you also have the best opportunity to mingle and network with industry professionals throughout the school year. Companies consistently send representative directly to the school for seminars and job fairs with the sole purpose of finding a college student to potentially employ. Having the chance to land an internship or even get a job offer at the U of A can often be a simple as showing up to a school event! To summarize, the University of Arizona is an amazing opportunity for anyone looking to get a world-class education in an environment where employers often come directly to you.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: So far my experience at UNE has been decent. I am a transfer student and the transfer was VERY stressful. I was always being directed to someone else there wasn't one person who could just help me with the overall transfer. I had to sign up for classes on my own which was very difficult being new to the college and their software system I had no idea which classes to sign up for that applied to my particular degree. Besides the transfer my experience at UNE has been wonderful the Professors are all very friendly and helpful, the school is clean, library hours are great!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I have now attended UNT for almost 3 years now. What drew to the school was   its affordability, as well as, the diversity. The campus includes a broad range of students, but even though many are from different backgrounds, the campus has the ability of bringing everyone together. While living on campus, I have never felt more safe, safety is a top priority for the school and I am proud to call myself an eagle. The resources available on school are simply amazing, so you should never feel behind on anything course related. For the future, I am considering on continuing with a graduate academic career in the near future at UNT. Go Mean Green!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Niche User
featuredReview.body: I enjoyed just about everything! The food was good, the place was interesting, and the people were very friendly and kind. Although, when I visited the campus with my mom for a conference the sidewalks were very dirty. At sundown, my mom just about plastered her face tripping over a large stick in the way. Overall it was pretty good though.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I love Maryville! The campus is beautiful and the environment is very welcoming! I've attended her for two semesters now, and the life coaches have been extremely helpful. I switched majors in between semesters and the instructors of the design program have been extremely helpful in getting me on track.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: This school is fantastic! The Christian community is something special that creates a welcoming, loving atosmophere unlike any other college. The faculty and staff pour everything they can into their students and go above and beyond in brilliant and heartwarming ways! Also, I have a disability, and the disability resource center is wonderful. The support and love I have felt at this school has truly changed my life and I am beyond grateful for PLNU!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade
